implementation.name: main_calculator_loop
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: This loop is the main entry point for the calculator app. It presents the user with options, takes input for two numbers, and performs addition when the user selects option 1. The addition operation directly implements the requirement to add given numbers and share the output.
implementation.pseudo_code:
PRINT 'Welcome to Calculator App'
LOOP forever:
    PRINT menu options (Addition, Subtraction, Multiplication, Division, Exit)
    GET user choice as integer
    GET first number as integer
    GET second number as integer
    IF choice == 1:
        PRINT 'Output: ', num1 + num2
    ELSE IF choice == 2:
        PRINT 'Output: ', num1 - num2
    ELSE IF choice == 3:
        PRINT 'Output: ', num1 * num2
    ELSE IF choice == 4:
        PRINT 'Output: ', num1 / num2
    ELSE IF choice == 5:
        PRINT 'Exiting...'
        BREAK
    PRINT newline

implementation.name: main calculator loop
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Implements the calculator logic, including the subtraction operation as one of the menu options. The subtraction is performed directly in the main loop when the user selects option 2.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Display 'Welcome to Calculator App'
Loop forever:
    Display menu options (Addition, Subtraction, Multiplication, Division, Exit)
    Get user choice
    Get first number from user
    Get second number from user
    If choice is 1:
        Output num1 + num2
    Else if choice is 2:
        Output num1 - num2
    Else if choice is 3:
        Output num1 * num2
    Else if choice is 4:
        Output num1 / num2
    Else if choice is 5:
        Print 'Exiting...'
        Break loop
    Print a blank line

missing_implementations: Subtracts the smaller number from the greater number (currently always does num1 - num2, not max-min)
No explicit handling for which number is greater; output can be negative but does not guarantee 'subtract smaller from greater'

implementation.name: main_calculator_loop
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Implements the calculator logic, including multiplication. When the user selects option 3, it multiplies two numbers and prints the output.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Print welcome message
Loop forever:
    Print menu options
    Get user choice as integer
    Get first number as integer
    Get second number as integer
    If choice is 1:
        Print sum of numbers
    Else if choice is 2:
        Print difference of numbers
    Else if choice is 3:
        Print product of numbers (num1 * num2)
    Else if choice is 4:
        Print division of numbers
    Else if choice is 5:
        Print exit message and break loop
    Print a blank line

implementation.name: main calculator loop
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Implements the calculator logic, including division when the user selects option 4. Handles user input for numbers and operation selection. The division is performed directly in the main loop.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Print welcome message
Loop forever:
    Print operation menu
    Get user choice
    Get first number
    Get second number
    If choice is Addition:
        Print sum
    Else if choice is Subtraction:
        Print difference
    Else if choice is Multiplication:
        Print product
    Else if choice is Division:
        Print result of num1 / num2
    Else if choice is Exit:
        Print exit message
        Break loop
    Print newline

missing_implementations: Should not be divided by zero.
Always handle the exception of dividing by zero.
Show the error if any of the input is having the error.
All error messages must be generic and user-friendly.
Internal error details must not be exposed to users.
Detailed errors must be logged securely for debugging.
All user inputs must be strictly validated and sanitized to ensure they are numbers within acceptable ranges and free from malicious content.

implementation.name: Division operation (main loop branch)
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Implements the division operation as part of the calculator's main loop. When the user selects option 4, it performs division of two user-provided inputs.
implementation.pseudo_code:
LOOP forever:
    Display menu options
    Get user choice as integer
    Get first number as integer input
    Get second number as integer input
    IF choice == 4:
        Output result of num1 / num2

missing_implementations: All error messages must be generic and user-friendly.
Internal error details must not be exposed to users.
Detailed errors must be logged securely for debugging.
All user inputs must be strictly validated and sanitized to ensure they are numbers within acceptable ranges and free from malicious content.
